Articles.Content:
This should probably be in the post your rover megathread, but I joined the party a bit late. Recently I've taken up using the B9 Aerospace mod parts, that look way cleaner to make most of my probes. One setup I used were the large Lack Luster Labs manned cockpits with some Kethane tanks in the middle (Sorry if I'm blanking on the mod name, maybe one of you guys can help me)

So naturally I perfected this design until I got a relatively effective vehicle

I present to you: The Kethler Rover

Mods Used:(To my knowledge)

-B9 Aerospace

-Lack Luster Labs (Once again, not what it's called, but I forgot the name)

You can see most of it, with an excessive amount of kethane tanks in the middle, and 4 FL-T800 fuel tanks (long 1.25m tanks) oriented where the center of mass will stay in the center no matter how much fuel they have, as long as they have have the same amount per tank. I also have some converter units and kethane scanners, to throw it all into one.

4 large solar panels with 4 small kethane drills

Molman seems a bit too happy considering he is one brake malfunction away from officially being the first Kerbal to be part of a planet

I know I don't have the .craft file or mods linked, but I will happily try to do either if any of you request them

wow i love this rover

How can you go to the mun with this?

It's at the Duna pole.

I see B9, LLL, and Kethane parts in that beast.
Lack Luster Labs is the correct name for it, you didn't brainfart that one.

wow i love this rover

How can you go to the mun with this?

Well I got it to Duna, so getting it to the Mun shouldn't be that hard.

At minimum a 6-way asparagus stage with mainsails, and some atomic engines should do the job
Ok, I'll shoot the elephant in the room. Per chance may we get the craft files so that we may explode utilize them?

Ok, I'll shoot the elephant in the room. Per chance may we get the craft files so that we may explode utilize them?

I will be able to within the next day. Like I said, LLL, B9 and Kethane are required. Also, i would suggest using subassembly manager, because the atomic rockets on my upper asparagus stage tend to explode, leaving me with the duty of manually refueling ALL my rocket in the asparagus staging, because i would simply not have enough thrust if i decoupled any of them.
I've got those plus several other mods to make life easier. Do you mind if I base a rover off yours using more stock and less mod parts?
